page.title: 04TOLLBRIDGE
page.content: In the 19th century,two farmers formed plans to join lands by a bridge. Bought in 1908 by General Estates Co.Original toll price board fixed on tollkeeper's cottage.Today about 1400 vehicles cross bridge per day.Busy during working days. Sunday busy because of visitors to{George Inn, {Bathampton. Bridge used to{bypass}City, crossing from{A4}to{A36.}Open from 07.00 to 22.00 each day.Weight limit 4 tons, Present tollkeeper in position 9 yrs. Current charges:-CARS-12pence-CAR & TRAILER-15p-MOTOR CYCLE-6p-CAR & CARAVAN-18p-VEHICLES OVER ONE TON -24p During{30 minute count}at 14.00 on July 1st 1985, 59 cars, 5 trucks, 6 cycles, 1 car & caravan and 10 pedestrians,passed through toll. Approximately Â£8.64 paid during this period.
